Targeted: According to the US Embassy Website in Bangladesh as of Nov 11, 2020 https://web.archive.org/web/20201111005505/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/:   "Currently, only certain sectors located within the Wari jurisdiction of the Dhaka South City Corporation are designated as ‘lockdown/containment’ zones. In these areas, the City Corporations will facilitate emergency response services.    It is important to note GoB officials have confirmed that the list of Red zones does not mean the areas are or will be under lockdown restrictions.    Restrictions on Designated Lockdown/Containment Areas:  - **Residents should remain within their homes except for emergencies or for essential needs.**  - **Residents must work from home.**  - Transportation will be suspended. Rickshaws, vans, taxis, auto-rickshaws, and private vehicles are not permitted inside the demarcated areas during the 21-day lockdown.  - No public gatherings of any kind are allowed.  - Pedestrian and vehicular movements controlled through secured entry/exit points.  - No indoor dining services allowed. Delivery food service options are available.  - Grocery stores and pharmacies will remain open.  - Residents will be allowed to shop in bazaars only when necessary.  - COVID-19 tests will be available to residents, and home isolation or institutional isolation will be arranged for patients who test positive.  - Shopping malls, gyms, sports complexes and recreation centres will be closed.  - Only people who are ill may go to hospitals.  - Mosques and other places of worship are closed to residents. Only official staff are permitted to enter.  - ATM services will remain open. Banks will operate in a limited capacity.  - Factories in towns will remain closed, but factories and agricultural production-related factories in rural areas can remain operational.  - Agricultural work must be performed under strict health and hygiene regulations."    This information has not changed as of Nov 18, 2020: https://web.archive.org/web/20201122221519/https://bd.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/      IN GENERAL: COVID19-related restrictions seem be removed, although with strict adherence to mask wearing.  Dhaka Tribune: "On October 31, the Cabinet Division sent notices to all public offices of the country, asking them to restrict entry and to refuse service to anyone without a mask. The notice further said masks have been made compulsory for all offices, courts, shopping malls, bazaars, state or government buildings and **social events**."  source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201122215536/https://www.dhakatribune.com/health/coronavirus/2020/11/02/no-restriction-on-public-movement-to-curb-second-wave-of-covid-19    Nov 12, reuters.com: "“The decision has been taken considering the second wave... We can’t play with the lives of our children,” said a senior official of the education ministry, who declined to be named. **The government however, has lifted most other restrictions**"  source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201122212335if_/https://www.reuters.com/article/us-health-coronavirus-bangladesh-educati/bangladesh-extends-school-shutdown-over-second-covid-19-wave-idUSKBN27S26A

No change.   Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes  Botswana is divided into 9 geographical zones (map available at gov.bw) and permits are only needed to travel between zones. Residents may travel within their zone without permits.  Permits for inter-zone travel may be acquired online at gov.bw and are restricted to essential travel. COVID-19 tests may be required at any time for those transiting zones. Tourism is considered essential travel for economic reasons, and Botswana residents may organize permit applications with a reservation confirmation from their destination lodging.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201206230207/https://www.gov.bw/about-covid-19  https://web.archive.org/web/20201206231725/https://bw.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

"The easing of restrictions will apply to the majority of the country excluding Havana, Ciego de Avila, and Sancti Spiritus province. Under the easing of COVID-19 restrictions, international commercial passenger flights will be permitted to resume operations in 13 of the 16 territories, however, international travel will continue to be severely disrupted as Havana is the main international airport to Cuba.    Those traveling into any of the 13 territories open will be required to take a COVID-19 PCR test upon arrival and must declare their health status; travelers may await their test results at their hotels or homes. Additionally, face masks are mandatory in all public areas. Recreation and entertainment facilities will be subject to additional health protocols."      No policy change. Policy remains same as above    https://web.archive.org/web/20201004195425/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/385211/cuba-authorities-lift-restrictions-in-havana-september-30-update-15

People are expected to stay within small groups (see below), wear a mask and keep distance, but there are currently no restrictions to only leave the house for necessary reasons.  Staying in public is only permitted with the members of your own household and of another household and has been limited to a maximum of 5 people since December 1st. Citizens are also asked to refrain from private trips and visits. From December 1st, private get-togethers with friends, relatives and acquaintances are only permitted with members of your own household and those of another household, a maximum of five people may come together.  https://web.archive.org/web/20201207221252/https://www.zusammengegencorona.de/en/inform/organising-everyday-life/
